column8: comment

Definition in EDM documentation: "The set of resources related to a single cultural heritage object that collectively represents that object in Europeana. Such set consists of: all descriptions about the object that Europeana collects from (possibly different) content providers, including thumbnails and other forms of abstractions, as well as of the description of the object Europeana builds"|DS does not host images
Equivalent class: E39_Actor (CIDOC CRM)
Equivalent class: E52_Time-Span (CIDOC-CRM)|"Time span" is a broader term for a specific type of span ("century"); time span is an "abstract temporal extent"
Equivalent class: E39_Actor (CIDOC CRM)
This property holds the identifier given to the dataset in Europeana.
DC namespace import; definition: "A related resource from which the described resource is derived in whole or in part."
The name or identifier of the organization who contributes data indirectly to an aggregation service
The name or identifier of the organization who contributes data indirectly to an aggregation service
The name or identifier of the organization who contributes data indirectly to an aggregation service
links to web representation|in EDM edm:hasView has range edm:WebResource
In DS "standard title" allows for greater recall by assigning an alternative label to search by, e.g., "Book of Hours"; dcterms:alternative operates similarly
EDM uses dc:creator as a property

most general contextual property in EDM. Contextual properties have typically to do either with the things that have happened to or together with the object under consideration, or what the object refers to by its shape, form or features in a figural or encoded form. Very broad coverage of "aboutness," including "scholarly classifications," i.e., genre and subject terms
hasType property in EDM does not cover "aboutness" so cannot be applied to subject or genre terms, presumably (different coverage)
language string vs. an authority identifier
takes an ISO-639 language tag, whereas a DS authority file for a language would link to a Wikidata page that linked to an ISO-639 authority file; hence my use of the "narrow match" predicate
in EDM "occurred at" is associated with a creation/production event and takes a time span value
in EDM "occurred at" is associated with a creation/production event and takes a time span value
An instance where EDM has borrowed another ontology property; there is no edm:medium property, strictly speaking, it simply uses the dcterms:medium property (importing the DC terms namespace)
An instance where EDM has borrowed another ontology property; there is no edm:medium property, strictly speaking, it simply uses the dcterms:medium property (importing the DC terms namespace)
Per the EDM definition this property is used differently than ds:startTime; "edm:begin" relates to a time span or agent, not the CHO itself
See note for edm:begin
